title: Chapter 47
body:
Chapter 47


Most of the students in class could not understand how Jiang Chao could make that bunch of boys who had always surrounded him become so sorrowful and angry, as if Jiang Chao had killed their fathers.


You gotta know, Jiang Chao was a veteran manga fan. Every word he uttered regarding the tittle-tattles within the world of manga experts was well-grounded and reasoned. In this semester, he recommended several high-quality manga-s to his classmates. Therefore, he had some prestige in class. Those classmates who were interested in the world of manga was mainly because of Jiang Chao. Naturally they looked up to Jiang Chao as their leader and gradually created a small bunch in a united way. Unfortunately, this was a high school which was very particular about the examination results, as a consequence, there were no curricular activities in school. Otherwise, Jiang Chao would definitely organize a Manga Study Club.


However, Jiang Chao’s current “Manga Study Club” was on the verge of falling apart. For students who were not interested in manga, of course they were gloating over what had happened. The person who always disdained Jiang Chao was none other than Zhao Youyue’s ex-deskmate, Zhou Fang. Crowing over the happenings, she had stretched her neck even higher to show her complacent expression. As a top student, Zhou Fang could never understand those fellars who wasted their time on meaningless manga-s and novels. She even felt that they were wasting their youth.


Zhao Youyue’s current deskmate, Jiang Qing did not crow over Jiang Chao’s misfortune. But she was very curious and concerned about the situation outside the classroom. She even asked Zhao Youyue to join the crowd. She subconsciously asked Zhao Youyue, “Lady Zhao, what do you think had happened between them?”


Zhao Youyue did not answer but quickly came to a realization. Perhaps the destructive “Pure Romance’s” ending had made that bunch of boys who were happily chasing after “Pure Romance” felt rather entrapped. After flashback of some memories, they recalled that it was Jiang Chao, this dumb-ass who had hard-sold “Pure Romance” to them, leading them to be entrapped, and trusted the evil Drug Lord mangaka, Su Li!


Zhao Youyue was kind of guilty internally, in a sense that she was the mastermind behind the curtain who was manipulating “Pure Romance’s” storyline. She had no choice but wanted to use Xu Jing’s ability in the manga to improve her examination results. However, she did not expect Su Li to have changed her from being a passer-by to a supporting character. At last, Su Li even decided to make her as the female protagonist.


She could not be humble either since the creator had decided to make her a female protagonist. As a last resort, she could only use an extreme way to set up “Xu Jing’s” character. This was because “Pure Romance” was a Harem manga which had something to do with the characters’ IQ and most of the storyline relied on its erotic scenes. So how could “Xu Jing” become a memorable iconic character that would be remembered by every reader in such Harem manga?!


This is known as fighting fire with fire!


Initially, Zhao Youyue resented Su Li, who tried hard to find fault within her. But she accidentally caused countless of readers ot be entrapped ruthlessly…


However, Zhao Youyue was not the one to have taken the blame but these were all Su Li’s fault.


Outside the classroom, Xu Haitao patted his chest and spoke to Jiang Chao with a pitiful expression, “Brother Chao! I have really treated you as my own brother! I trusted you so much but why were you recommending ‘Pure Romance’ to me? That mangaka named Su Li, she is simply evil and of course a ‘Drug Lord’!”


Jiang Chao felt shameful to answer Xu Haitao’s complains as he had also held a strong grudge towards Su Li, the malevolent female mangaka.


Jiang Chao was currently becoming a fan who completely turned to the dark side!


“Xu Jing” was his goddess and eventually she was left behind with such an ending. Besides, that “nice boat” ending was simply a sinkhole for readers! This was a typical way of showing the readers some crappy stories and deliberately packaged the storyline into a chocolate with tempting looks!


“Do you know how much I’ve sacrificed for ‘Pure Romance’? In order to call on this bunch of fellars who were used to reading pirated manga online to support ‘Drug Lord’ Su Li, to read her original version, and even to tip ‘Pure Romance’, I had… allowed this bunch of fellars to touch my B-cup chest to vent their sexual desire after reading ‘Pure Romance’. After all of this, you’re telling me that ‘Pure Romance’ has come to such an ending?! Now, I really want to end my life!” The fats on Xu Haitao’s face were trembling, he almost cried his heart out and felt wronged!


Meanwhile, the surrounding “Manga Study Club’s” members were all silently lowering their heads, inexplicably wanted to laugh after listening to Xu Haitao’s words.


Jiang Chao’s former expression of a man who had nothing to live for immediately changed. He shouted, “Oh f*ck! There is such a trick?”


After that, Jiang Chao reached out to Xu Haitao’s chest. So this was the feeling of touching the legendary B-cup chest?!


Jiang Chao immediately ran away after touching Xu Haitao’s chest, and then Xu Haitao chased after Jiang Chao crazily. He wanted to catch Jiang Chao, so that he could hang him up and beat him as much as he could. As a result, both of them were caught and reprimanded by Mr. Qiu relentlessly. Mr. Qiu even warned them if both of them failed their final exams, they were going to be punished!


Both of them showed an expression of feeling wronged. The ending of “Pure Romance” made them even more depressed which they simply could not do well in their exams!


Argh, they would definitely fail in the final exams!


However, it was alright to fail the final exams as when they began their second semester, teachers would always forget about the warnings they gave in the previous semester.


…


Zhao Youyue found herself very fulfilling in the three night-revision lessons. With the threatening of final exams, she forced herself to study and found a slight sensation just like how Xu Jing was obsessed with studying. When she thought she could directly use Xu Jing’s ability in the future, her mood became joyful.


When she was on her way home, she finally took out her phone in the car. At this moment, she felt really great playing with her hand phone. The first reason was that she actually endured for a long time. Secondly, she did her revision in a serious way and made her felt at peace of mind, therefore, when she was playing her phone, she came out to be convincing and faithful self.


She started scrolling Weibo and found out the ending of “Pure Romance” had become Weibo’s hot topic!


“Darkened”, “Cleaver” and “Nice boat” these words became so common all of a sudden. Besides, the character name that everyone mentioned the most was none other than Xu Jing!


This was definitely due to Xu Jing’s character who turned out to be the most controversial ever. Her experiences in the manga as well as her character itself were the most overflowing thing in “Pure Romance”. It could even be said that she was the only one who had IQ, while the one with the IQ of 250, missy Liu Sha, she was actually rather silly, not really sensible and stubborn. Before Xu Jing plotted against the male protagonist just because of Yang Xixi, with her own ability, Xu Jing revenged in replace for her parents. This led to a lot of discussions at once and almost no one dared to question Xu Jing’s retaliated behaviour, as her vengeance really did work off one’s anger and seemed rather enjoyable.


However, just when Xu Jing plotted against the male protagonist due to her distorted love towards Yang Xixi, Xu Jing had turned into a darkened self and this gradually triggered the debates. Since the ending of “Pure Romance” had been released, the debates about this character and the dissatisfaction with the ending had also reached its peak!


Lastly, Su Li’s promise was totally a joke!
